inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization URL for NetSuite.
inputs.label: Authorize URL

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Token URL for NetSuite. Replace <ACCOUNT_ID> with your account ID, which can be found in your browser's URL bar when you log in to NetSuite - https://<ACCOUNT_ID>.app.netsuite.com/
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: A space-delimited set of one or more scopes. This will always be rest_webservices
inputs.label: Scopes

inputs.comments: Generate a consumer key when you create your OAuth 2.0 app in NetSuite
inputs.label: Consumer Key (Client ID)

inputs.comments: Generate a consumer secret when you create your OAuth 2.0 app in NetSuite
inputs.label: Consumer Secret (Client Secret)

documentation.description:
To make API requests to NetSuite on behalf of your customers, your customer will need to create an OAuth 2.0 app.
[NetSuite's OAuth 2.0](https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/netsuite/ns-online-help/chapter_157769826287.html) documentation details the steps that need to be taken.

As an administrator, your customer will need to:

1. Enable SuiteTalk

    - Click **Setup** -> **Company** -> **Enable Features**
    - Under the **Suite Cloud** tab, ensure **REST WEB SERVICES** and **OAUTH 2.0** are both checked

1. Create an OAuth 2.0 app

    - Click **Setup** -> **Integration** -> **Manage Integrations** -> **New**
    - Give your integration a name and description
    - Un-check **TOKEN-BASED AUTHENTICATION** and **TBA: AUTHORIZATION FLOW** under **Token-based Authentication**
    - Ensure **AUTHORIZATION CODE GRANT**" and **REST WEB SERVICES** are checked under **OAuth 2.0**
    - Enable **REST WEB SERVICES** under **SCOPE**
    - Enter https<!---->://oauth2.prismatic.io/callback as your **REDIRECT URI**
    - Take note of your **CONSUMER KEY** and **CONSUMER SECRET**

1. Create OAuth 2.0 Roles
    - Ensure that any user who wishes to log in via OAuth has been assigned a [proper role](https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/netsuite/ns-online-help/section_157771510070.html).

As an integration developer, you will need to mark **Consumer Key**, **Consumer Secret**, and **Token URL** organization- and customer-visible, as your end user will need to edit them with their own values.

display.label: Raw Request
display.description: Send a raw HTTP request to NetSuite API

inputs.comments: Input the path only (/contact), The base URL is already included (https://${accountId}.suitetalk.api.netsuite.com/services/rest/${restAPIServiceType}/v1). For example, to connect to https://${accountId}.suitetalk.api.netsuite.com/services/rest/${restAPIServiceType}/v1/contact, only /contact is entered in this field.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

documentation.description: [Oracle NetSuite](https://www.netsuite.com/) is a unified business management suite, encompassing ERP/Financials, CRM and ecommerce.
documentation.dev: For more details refer to [NetSuite's API documentation](https://system.netsuite.com/help/helpcenter/en_US/APIs/REST_API_Browser/record/v1/2022.1/index.html).
